identificationModule.briefTitle: How to Identify Fatigue in Stroke Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: How to Identify Fatigue in Stroke Patients: Validity of the Post-stroke Fatigue Case Definition

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study will translate an English case definition of poststroke fatigue and validate it against the Multidimensional Fatigue Questionnaire-20 and the Fatigue Severity Scale

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean MFI-20 score for case positive patients
primaryOutcomes.description: Describes validity of the case definition with regards to the MFI-20 questionnaire

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean FSS-7 score for case positive patients
primaryOutcomes.description: Describes validity of the case definition with regards to the FSS-7 questionnaire

secondaryOutcomes.measure: inter rater variability of the case definition
Optimal cut off score for case positiveness on MFI-20 and FSS
secondaryOutcomes.description: decide the optimal cut-off score on the two questionnaires to define case positiveness
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at inclusion in the trial (which is the time the values used are measured)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Patients with a clinical stroke within the last 6 months as judged by a senior doctor or by the research assistant.

Patients that have given written informed consent

-

Exclusion Criteria:

Patients with aphasia, dementia or cognitive deficits so severe that they are unable to understand the purpose of the interview and the questionnaire. -
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: stroke patients with a new stroke within 120 days
